title: 106_s2757
content: Transfer of administrative jurisdiction over certain lands from the Secretary of the Interior to the Secretary of the Air Force in New Mexico. Transfer of administrative jurisdiction over certain lands from the Secretary of the Interior to the Secretary of the Air Force in New Mexico includes various sections in T. 1 N., R. 30 E. and T. 1 S., R. 30 E. with specific lot designations and land divisions. Sec. 32: E\1/2\E\1/2\ and Sec. 33: W\1/2\E\1/2\, NW\1/4\, S\1/2\SW\1/4\ totaling 6,713.90 acres, more or less. Upon transfer, the surface estate becomes real property under the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1949. The mineral estate is withdrawn from appropriation under public land laws, except for the Materials Act of 1947. The Materials Act of 1947 allows the Secretary of the Air Force to use sand, gravel, or similar mineral resources on specified lands for construction needs at Melrose Air Force Range, New Mexico. Additionally, administrative jurisdiction over certain lands at Yakima Training Center, Washington, is transferred from the Secretary of the Interior to the Secretary of the Army. The curr_chunk is about the Willamette Meridian. The curr_chunk provides detailed information about land sections in different townships and ranges, including specific divisions and portions of land within each section. The curr_chunk lists specific land sections in different townships and ranges, detailing divisions and portions of land within each section totaling 6,640.02 acres. The curr_chunk describes the transfer of surface estate and withdrawal of mineral estate for specific lands totaling 6,640.02 acres. The surface estate becomes real property under the Federal Property and Administrative Services Act, while the mineral estate is withdrawn from public land laws except for specific acts. The Willamette Meridian is mentioned in the transfer of surface estate and withdrawal of mineral estate for specific lands totaling 6,640.02 acres. The Willamette Meridian is mentioned in the transfer of surface estate and withdrawal of mineral estate for specific lands totaling 6,640.02 acres. In T. 16 N., R. 20 E., Sec. 12: All, Sec. 18: Lot 4 and SE\1/4\, Sec. 20: S\1/2\. T. 16 N., R. 21 E., Sec. 4: Lots 1, 2, 3, and 4, S\1/2\NE\1/2\, Sec. 8: All. T. 16 N., R. 22 E., Sec. 12: All. T. 17 N., R. 21 E., Sec. 32: S\1/2\SE\1/4\, Sec. 34: W\1/2\. Aggregating 3,090.80 acres. The Secretary of the Army may use sand, gravel, or similar mineral material resources on the described lands without application to the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary of the Army can use mineral resources on specific lands for construction needs at the Yakima Training Center in Washington, without needing approval from the Secretary of the Interior. The Senate passed S. 2757 on October 5, 2000, allowing for the transfer of certain lands at Melrose Air Force Range, New Mexico, and Yakima Training Center, Washington.
